comments:
M4 compiler gives internal compiler error with a static import I came across
when trying to compile Bamboo (bamboo-dht.org, if you want to replicate).

in bamboo.dht.PutGetTest.java,
> import static bamboo.openhash.redir.RedirClient.bi2bytes;
says "import cannot be resolved" despite it being present.
replacing it with 
> import static bamboo.openhash.redir.RedirClient.*;
causes the error.

strack trace from "Problems" pane:

I'll try to reproduce with latest.

ok - I was using the 24Nov bamboo snapshot if you plan to do it that way:
http://bamboo-dht.org/bamboo-cvs-2004-11-24.tgz

The two imports:
import static bamboo.openhash.redir.RedirClient.bi2bytes;
import static bamboo.openhash.redir.RedirClient.bytes2bi;

doesn't seem to be a problem anymore with latest. Could you please try with
tomorrow's integration build?

Since I cannot generate the CallBack class it is difficult to be sure that the
problem is fixed.

Ok, i'll try it with tomorrow's build and get back to you. Until then, you could
run 

perl -w Callback.pl >Callback.java from src/bamboo/lss/ 

to generate Callback. (you may need to do similar in bamboo/src/dht for
gateway_protClient.java - see Makefile)

Thanks, Tim

Could not reproduce with I20050118-1015 linux gtk. Seems to have been fixed.
I'll leave it to you to resolve to fixed if you're happy that it is.
Thanks,
Tim
